clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Different Tools to Facilitate Nasotracheal Tube Placement Under Video-laryngoscope Use
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Techniques of Magill Forceps and Cuff Inflation to Facilitate Nasotracheal Tube Placement Under Video-laryngoscope Use

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: to investigate the effectiveness of techniques of either using Magill forceps or cuff inflation in facilitation of nasotracheal tube advancement into trachea

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who undergo oxo-maxillofacial surgery need naso-tracheal intubation to present good surgical view-field. but, sometimes, the naso-tracheal tube is unable to advance from nasopharynx, oropharynx, into trachea without assistance. Using techniques of either Magill forceps or cuff inflation is advantageous is not determined.

primary_outcome.measure: the technique spending time in this time interval and first attempt successful rate
primary_outcome.description: to measure the time taken of either using Magill forceps or with cuff inflation techniques in successfully intubated patients

secondary_outcome.description: measure the whole intubation time taken from tube tip into selected nostril, to nasopharynx, to oropharynx, into trachea, till capnography showing of 3 consecutive CO2 waveforms

secondary_outcome.measure: glottic injury and cuff damages during tube advanced
secondary_outcome.description: to assess the bleeding point of glottic area and the cuff injury of endotracheal tube

secondary_outcome.measure: postoperative nasal bleeding, sore throat and hoarseness
secondary_outcome.description: Events of intubating related nasal bleeding were measured on selected nostril and oral cavity at 3 minutes post-intubation. Incidences of sore throat and hoarseness are evaluated before patients out of recovery room and the coming morning

arm_group.description: experimental Magill forceps group: Magill forceps technique to facilitate nasotracheal tube advancement into trachea
experimental cuff inflation group: cuff inflation technique to facilitate nasotracheal tube advancement into trachea

intervention.description: Magill forceps techniques to facilitate nasotracheal tube advancement into trachea
cuff inflation techniques to facilitate nasotracheal tube advancement into trachea

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I-III
2. aged 20-65 years
3. Requiring Nasotracheal Intubation under general anesthesia
4. unlimited mouth open
5. unlimited neck motion
Exclusion Criteria:
1. mouth open ＜ 3 cm
2. Ankylosing arthritis patients.
3. BMI≧35 kg/m2
